main event: A fast-moving, fiery, round object was observed in the vicinity of Zanderij Airport in Paramaribo, Suriname, South America on November 3, 1962.
interesting points: The object was observed through binoculars and appeared to be listening.
The object changed course and direction several times, initially appearing to be a star but then moving in a parabolic course.
The observer, Robert P. Herrabrugh, could not identify the object and thought it might not be a U.S. satellite.
The sighting occurred around 5:30 pm local time.
Herrabrugh requested information about what he observed.
